page.title: 17BRYMBO STEELWORKS
page.content: {Brymbo Steelworks}is situated about two miles west of Wrexham. The factory produces high quality low alloy and special carbon steel.Much of the steel is exported. The steel is used by vehicle manufacturers.The factory also produces steel for drills and bits for oil rigs;and heavy chains for the mining industry. In 1787 John Wilkinson came to Brymbo to make iron.He chose Brymbo because here there was iron ore in the ground,limestone and coal.He found,too that the people of Brymbo were hard workers. Iron has now changed to steelmaking. The Steelworks is owned by Guest,Keen and Nettlefolds. Many parents work at Brymbo Steelworks.
